intro: Erica thomensis, commonly known as the Tomé's heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Erica thomensis is adapted to coastal conditions, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
